content:
Mind grabbing photos from Oscar Ciutat, a photographer in Barcelona, Spain, seem to provoke this thought deeply. These images are part of a series called "Caged", entirely comprised of captive animals from the Barcelona Zoo. What can be seen looking back in the eye that beholds you, something tangible or nothing at all, is for you to decide.

Of his works Oscar says: "It is said that the eyes are the windows to the soul. I took a series of trips to the local zoo to photograph the eyes of animals held in captivity. I was intrigued by whether the lack of freedom would be apparent in the images." 
What answers he found, we may never know for certain. Yet those who see his works will reach some conclusion themselves rather easily.

While zoos are amazing and the animals a glory to behold, it does make one wonder at times, what would an entire life in a cage be like surrounded by loud, hairless apes? I'm not sure if it would be more 
 or a bad prison movie. I do know I'm happy I don't have to find out for myself.
title: Looking Into the Eye of the Beast
author: MichDe
